column5: My condolences Paul

My deepest heartfelt thanks to you all, for the kind words of sympathy and PM's of supprt and consolation. The wake and funeral are over, and Mom and Dad have been reunited. I reconnected with familly i haven't seen in years, and we all celibrated her life, the way she would have wanted us too, with love and fond memories. As i sat there and listened at the church, as her pastor talked about her love of life, and her love for friends and familly, a gentle breeze touched my face, and for an instant, i smelled her perfume.No one else noticed, but i did, and thats all that counts.  Thanks from my familly to you and yours.   Paul
Tomorrow will bring a new dawn my friend

Sorry to hear about your loss. Sometimes in this fast pace of life we forget what we should cherish the most, and unfortunately, that realization often comes when its too late.  Lately I have been telling myself that 'soon' I will spend more time with my parents and 'really' communicate with them.  I could go on and on ... but my heart and condolences go out to you and your family members.  God bless.
So sorry for your loss Paul.

So sorry to see this thread. The loss of a Mother or Father can be one of the most trying times in ones life. Stay strong. My warmest wishes for weeks ahead Im shure that your mother is proud of you.  Don
Sorry for your loss bud.  I can't even imagine
Very sorry to hear this news.  My thoughts to you and your family and deepest condolences.

My sincerest most heartfelt thanks to all of you.Its been a long and emotional day.I`m fine for hours, then a wave of grief rolls over me and takes my breath away, i  can't even speak a word.Who would have thought that emotional pain could be so physically painful. I am sure that in time, my sadness will be replaced by warm memories of her. I will never forget the comforting words and support that i received both here and in the PM's i recieved from you.   God Bless all of you. I have made it through today with a little help from my friends   Paul
Right back atcha bud. You give and shall receive
My condolences to you and your loved ones,
My sincerest condolences Paul...She served you well by making you who you are...Im sure you'll serve her well and instill her memory to those that precede  May She Rest In Peace
Sorry for your loss Paul. Doesn't matter how old you get, it's never easy losing a parent. My condolances to you and the rest of her family/loved ones.
So sorry to read this Paul our thoughts are with you
Very sorry to hear of the news Paul.  Sincerest condolences to you, your family and friends. Thoughts & prayers are with you in this time of sorrow. Jacques
You know what I am going to say Paul.  Phil
My condolences Paul. I too lost my dad to dementia and my mom to the big "C" My other friends (the sober ones) were a great help to me at that time No home Pc's back in those days
Sorry for your loss.
Sorry for your loss-my condolences to you and your family

Paul, I do not need to tell you how I feel, I think you know.. Be strong my friend as you have said to me.. Like others have said and you have said to me.. Remember all the good times and cherish them always
My deepest condolences my friend
Sorry to hear Paul. Stay strong
I do Phil, and thats exactly what i am doing
sorry for your loss
My sincere condolences Paul.
Really sorry for your loss.
My sincere condolences Paul...
Very sorry to hear of your mom's passing, you have my deepest condolenses.  Take care.
My condolences Paul.
Deeply sorry for your loss Paul.
Sorry for your loss, may the happy memories carry you onwards.

A very sincere thanks to all. I woke up this morning and went outside with my dogs.The sun still below the horizon, and a faint orange glow.Said a little prayer and looked skyward to be greeted by a single star against the deep blue cloudless sky.I feel sad but at peace now. Found this pic of her from our Las Vegas/Grand Canyon trip a couple of years ago. Says it all i think. She would have been 80 next year.
Sorry to hear Paul. My condolences to you and your family

Paul,  Cindy and I send our deepest condolences to you and your family...our prayers are with her and you.  We are the same age so I know how it is to be parent-less....I lost my mom way back in 1984 and my dad in 2001, a month after 9/11....   Bob & Cindy
sorry for your loss.   My condolences to your and your family.  Losing a Parent is never easy.  Let others help with your grieving.  Time will help you mend.  Nick
Very Sorry to hear about your loss. She has gone to a better place and her spirit will live on in you. May she rest in peace.

Very sorry for your loss, Paul. Dementia is a terrible disease, she truly is in a better place now.  My own mother has been struggling with it for over 10 years and has now deteriated to the point of non-recognition of her own family, it breaks my heart everytime we visit.
My deepest condolensces.  Rich
My deepest condolences Paul. I know the feelling.
Sorry for your loss Paul. I feel for you and your family.
So sorry for your loss Paul  Dave
Very sorry to hear about your Mom. Take comfort in knowing your mom is with your dad now and both are watching over you!  My deepest condolences!  Greg
Very sorry for you loss.
condolences Paul  B
Sorry for your loss Paul. My condolences.
sorry to hear the terrible news paul...my condolences to you,and your family
Sorry to hear this Paul it is good that the memories live on in you and others hearts.   Art
This was the first post I read this morning Paul, didn't set the day off well for me as I have travelled this path fairly recently.  My heart felt condolences to you and your family.

Sorry to hear of this news Merky  I know both your parents will always be around to talk to when you need them.  Both my parents have been gone some time but we took my Mother in law in who has dementia----I know of what you say also  Take Care Bud  Terrence

My and Jeanne's condolences to you and your family, Paul. There are never any really good words to say to someone who loses the biggest part of their family but I know you can handle it. You've overcome or have come to terms with some formidable adversaries in your life. You'll get through this one and Mom will be there with you.
this means more than you can think of Paul in my mind!
scary but take it for what it's worth and to me that's her star!  good luck my friend in your healing process and may God Rest her Soul...  Geoff
Sorry to here about your mom Paul. You have my deepest condolences....

I lost my Mom about an hour ago. Well actually, i lost her in June when Dimentia began creeping between us. It crept into her mind quietly, but very very quickly.Robbing her of her of her memory, and ability to do what most of us take for granted.Think. Last Christmas she was weak, but still sharp as a tack, February we notice that she got confused easily,April she began forgeting things she did and said hours before, June she couldnt take care of herself.The Docs began to play with her Meds,trying to find the right combination to slow down her rapid deterioration, but were unable to do anything.She became chair bound and spent the next 4 months waiting for a long term care facility.Finally, last week she was transfered to her new home. She passed tonite quietly from an aparent heart attack.  So now i find myself parentless, and feeling kinda lost. When Dad passed, there was always Mom. Now they will both live forever in my memories.  In Loving memory  Emma Elsie Brule Douglas Robert White  I love you both dearly.Rest easy.  Your kids  Paul Douglas White Brian Robert White Janice Marlene White
I am sorry to hear that Paul.
I'm so sorry for your loss Paul....  Just remember your never alone... You have Barb... And a long list of friends that are there for you.....
My condolences Paul. Surround yourself with the right friends now. You may need them more than you realize.
Sorry for your loss Paul. My condolences.
So sorry for your loss Paul, at least it sounds like she passed peacefully.

I am ever so sorry for your loss. When we lose someone close to ourselves we lose a part of ourselves as well. Cherish all that was beautiful in your mother. Remember the love she had for you. That is thr greatest tribute you can give to her memory.
My condolences Paul.
I'm so sorry for your loss...My condolences Paul.
My condolences bud.
I know we do t know each other but in this time of loss my heart goes out to you and your family.  May your mother rest in peace and your family find comfort in these days. My condolences Bill
Hard times. My condolences.

Sorry to hear this Paul and know the gut wrench well.  The good of it is she's now in a better place than living the evil hell of dimentia. Reflect on the days pre Christmas last year and find some smiles in there. I'm sure, as you give it some thought, it'll be easy to find more than a few!

My sincere condolences Paul. Losing the second parent can be one of the toughest things anyone will ever experience. You're going to see her in your dreams now and then and as someone told me, this is her way of checking up on you and to let you know that she's ok and not to worry.
So sorry, Paul.  peter
Sorry to hear that, I know it must be very hard for you. My condolences.

Very sorry to hear that Paul, my condolances to you and your family.  It shocks me how fast the dementia took hold from your description of events.  Very sad indeed and I hope to never have to deal with that in my lifetime.  Keep strong bud!!!
My deepest condolences Paul. That dementia is a terrible thing. Treasure the good times and the memories from long ago.
I'm sorry to hear of loss, Paul. You will always have their memories, and if your experience is like mine, that will become a good place that you visit often.
So sorry to hear this news Paul. It is never easy to loose a loved one.  Ron...
Sorry to hear that Paul, it's really tough losing our parents.  I watched my dad die from the same terrible disease so I know what you went through.

I just woke from a dream i was having of my long passed grandparents and differant uncles and aunts and brothers and sisters of mine , how strange of me to dream this tonight , they were all around me waving their hands and smiling at me , i awoke with my arm in the air waving back and found my self crying for real . After a bit i was wide a wake so  i  got up and came and turn the computer on and found this your posting of the lost of your mom tonight . I  am realy sorry for your lost Paul and that your moms time here on earth with you is over . All i can say now to you Paul is to watch for her wave my freind , she wont be far away and that she will now truly get to rest with peace . The times you's shared together will heal your lost in the days ahead as you journey ever closer to where we all will meet again , til then remember we your freinds will be walking with you . My hand go's out to you your brother and your sister on this night .
sorry for your loss

My condolences Paul: I lost my Dad to that dreadful disease and my Mum to cancer 18 months before. I know all too well your loss. Keep them alive in the your memory. They live on in you and your family.
Sorry about you mother passing. I'm sure you and your family have many fond memories. Her problems are past now and she is now free of any burdens.
